main event: Multiple reports of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) observed near Fairfax, Oklahoma in the 1950s, including bright orange lights travelling at high speeds and changing formation, silver-white pancake-shaped objects remaining stationary and then moving rapidly and silently, and two bright lights observed at Fairfax Air Force Base.
interesting points: The observed objects exhibited various shapes and behaviors, from bright orange lights in fixed and V-shaped formations to silver-white disk-shaped objects remaining stationary and then moving rapidly at high altitudes.

Witnesses reported observing these objects silently and traveling at tremendous speeds, covering large distances in short periods of time. No sound was heard, and no physical evidence was left at the scenes.
There were no flight plans or known aircraft associated with the reported UFO sightings, and a search of radar sites and adjacent areas failed to produce any information on the objects.

Personnel at the Tulsa Tower and 756th Aircraft Control and Warning Squadron indicated no knowledge of the reported sightings, and the observations did not align with known phenomena like hydrogen balloons or conventional aircraft.

Some reports indicate the observations were made by credible individuals, including an Air Force Officer, an observer working at the Windmill Inn, and an air policeman on patrol duty at Fairfax Air Force Base.
sighted object: Various unidentified flying objects including bright lights and silver-white disk-shaped objects
witnesses: Credible witnesses including Air Force personnel, observatory staff, and an air policeman
photographs: No, the reports do not indicate the presence of any photographs of the observed objects
